definitions.definition: having a mild temperature without extremes of heat or cold

examples.text: a country with a temperate climate
In winter, the birds fly from the Arctic to more temperate zones.
The temperate latitudes were once much colder than they are today.
These plants are only found in temperate regions.

definitions.definition: behaving in a calm way and with control

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘not affected by passion or emotion’): from Latin temperatus ‘mingled, restrained’, from the verb temperare.
